Publication Title: Apolipoprotein E2 Stimulates Protein Synthesis and Promotes Melanoma Progression and Metastasis
Publication Authors: Nneoma Adaku, Benjamin N Ostendorf, Wenbin Mei, Sohail F Tavazoie
Publication Abstract: The secreted lipid transporter apolipoprotein E (APOE) plays important roles in atherosclerosis and Alzheimer's disease and has been implicated as a suppressor of melanoma progression. The APOE germline genotype predicts human melanoma outcomes, with APOE4 and APOE2 allele carriers exhibiting prolonged and reduced survival, respectively, relative to APOE3 homozygotes.
